access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a generic ROI authorization form with a 'MYSELF' checkbox for self-access, or can use an online Swellbox wizard; completed PDF forms are faxed to facility-specific HIM departments.

red_flags: Purpose field required without patient access exception (HIPAA ยง 164.524 does not require patients to state a reason)
Minimum necessary standard applied to patient self-access requests (contrary to 45 CFR ยง 164.502(b)(2)(v))
English form is an image-only scan with no text layer while translated versions are digital
bright_spots: Forms available in 4 languages (English, Spanish, Haitian Creole, Portuguese) reflecting South Florida demographics
Swellbox online portal provides a fully digital alternative pathway
Explicit CFR 164.524 Right of Access reference in patient rights disclosures
Granular record type selection with date-range filtering for lab and radiology reports

findability.rationale: Level 4: Medical Records Request page is reachable in 3 clicks from homepage with clear navigation and all 4 language versions linked; moderate friction from Cloudflare bot blocking and a case-sensitive broken URL for the English form.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Swellbox online portal provides a mostly digital pathway for submission; however the PDF forms have zero fillable fields and the English version is an image-only scan, so the PDF path itself is a paper workflow offset by the portal alternative.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Single-page form with logical section flow and comprehensive record type checklist, but dense layout, legalistic language, garbled text in translated versions, and no explicit instructions for patients.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: The 'MYSELF' checkbox allows patient self-access but the form is fundamentally a third-party authorization; patients must navigate irrelevant fields, an unnecessary purpose requirement, and minimum necessary language that shouldn't apply to their requests.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Witness signature line creates a barrier not required by HIPAA for patient access; minimum necessary language inappropriately applied to individual access; purpose field required without exception; voluntary authorization and revocation rights properly stated.

overall.summary: Broward Health offers exceptional multilingual support and a Swellbox online alternative, but the core PDF pathway relies on an outdated, non-fillable generic ROI form with compliance concerns around witness requirements and minimum necessary language applied to patient self-access.
